job_description: STEM Aspire Mentorship Program What is it? STEM Aspire is a mentorship initiative that links female university students with mentors from Dell Technologies. Its objective is to inspire and empower dedicated STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) students, encouraging them to pursue fulfilling careers in the technology sector. This encompasses potential areas such as Computer Science, Software Engineering, Networking, IT Management, and related fields. The program will run from March till June 2024 , all events are mandatory for program completion. What are the Benefits: Gain the chance to collaborate with a mentor and participate in regular meetings to deepen your comprehension of the IT industry Develop insight into technical careers within Dell Technologies Connect and network with accomplished women at Dell Technologies and fellow mentees Acquire guidance for internship and graduate applications, covering preparation for CVs and interview readiness What are the qualifications? If you are a female student currently pursuing studies in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics), willing to participate in a mentorship program that includes online and onsite training sessions , and fully committed throughout the program's duration (3 months). How can I enroll? Ensure you submit your application for this posting by uploading your CV before 29 February 2024 . If your application is successful, you will receive a link to conduct a brief video interview to articulate the specified areas below: Your name, university, and major The area of technology that interests you the most Explain why you are interested in a mentoring program with Dell Technologies *By submitting your application, you are enrolling in a mentorship program. This is not a job offer nor an internship, and successfully completing the program will not lead to a full-time employment opportunity with Dell Technologies.
